data.title: Today’s national news in a nutshell

data.text:
KATHMANDU: Khabarhub brings you a glimpse of major developments of the day in Nepal, including politics, business/economy, sports, entertainment, and more.

US Assistant Secretary of State Donald Lu arrives in Kathmandu

US Assistant Secretary of State for South and Central Asia Donald Lu has arrived in Kathmandu today. During his visit to Nepal, Lu is scheduled to meet the leaders of Nepal’s political parties and embassy staff. Lu came directly to Nepal from America and will visit another country in South Asia.

US Assistant Secretary Lu calls on NC President Deuba

United States Assistant Secretary for the Bureau of South and Central Asian Affairs, Donald Lu, paid a courtesy call on Nepali Congress President and former Prime Minister Sher Bahadur Deuba on Friday afternoon. Lu who arrived in Kathmandu today on a day-long visit reached NC President Deuba’s residence, where the two leaders discussed how Nepal-US relations could be strengthened in the days ahead, according to Deuba’s Secretariat.

CPN-UML holding Secretariat meeting tomorrow

The CPN-UML is holding a meeting of its Secretariat to analyze recent political developments tomorrow. Rajendra Gautam, the Head of the UML Publicity Department, stated that the meeting has been called for July 15 at the party headquarters in Chyasal, Lalitpur.

Health Ministry urges all to continue anti-dengue drive

The Ministry of Health and Population has urged all sides concerned to continue the anti-dengue drive in the wake of rising cases of dengue. The spokesperson at the Ministry, Dr Samir Kumar Adhikari, urged all employees to involve in the sanitation campaign daily to drive away mosquitoes that cause dengue.

Landslide causes damages to micro hydel project in Myagdi

The powerhouse of Daramkhola Micro Hydropower Project at Lulang in Dhaulwagiri Rural Municipality-2 in Myagdi district has suffered damages after a landslide in the site. A landslide occurred at Mareni on Thursday has damaged the powerhouse of the hydel project, disrupting power supply to 400 households in the area.

Gold traded at Rs 112,500 per tola today

Gold price increased by Rs 100 in the domestic market today. According to the Nepal Gold and Silver Dealers’ Association, the price of fine gold was traded at Rs. 112,500 per tola and standard gold at Rs 111,950 per tola.

Bhanu Jayanti observed today

Adikavi Bhanubhakta Acharya was commemorated by organizing various programs among Nepali community at home and abroad to mark his 210th birth anniversary today. Born at Chundiramgha in Tanahun district on Asar 29, 1871 BS, the first Nepali poet contributed immensely to uniting the country through language, literature and culture by offering various creations.

Two die in separate road accidents

Two persons died in two separate road accidents in Jhapa district last night. Pillion rider Upendra Sigdel, 40, died after a van (Pra1-01-002 Ha 267) and motorcycle (Me 7 Pa 8594) from the same direction collided each other near a bridge over Kamalkhola (river) along the East-West Highway.

Buddha Air plane heading to Jhapa diverted to Kathmandu after experiencing technical issues

The Buddha Air flight from Kathmandu to Bhadrapur in Jhapa has returned to Kathmandu after experiencing technical issues 15 minutes after take off. According to TIA sources, the 9N-AJO plane that took off from Tribhuvan Airport was turned back within 15 minutes of takeoff due to technical issues.

ACC Men’s Emerging Teams Asia Cup: Nepal loses to Pakistan by 4 wickets

In the first match of the ACC Men’s Emerging Teams Asia Cup held in Sri Lanka, Nepal suffered a defeat against Pakistan ‘A’. In Group B, Pakistan defeated Nepal by 4 wickets. Pakistan completed the target of 180 runs given by Nepal by losing 6 wickets in 32 overs of 5 balls.
